alert.note: Alert for Gallia (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 10:09AM EDT until May 10 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... West Virginia... Ohio River At Point Pleasant affecting Gallia and Mason Counties. For the Ohio River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River At Point Pleasant. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 42.0 feet, The Little Kyger Road in Ohio is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 41.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EDT Monday was 41.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 41.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 41.7 feet on 04/30/1937. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EDT.
